poem:
*Borderlines*

In the still dawn,
a name miscast—
Harris, woven
with the dust and fence.
Critique sharp as rusted wire,
straddles earth and ambition,
questions, relentless as wind,
that fray and entwine,
chasing shadows
across a boundary
ever blurred.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump criticized by Republicans and Democrats after questioning Harris’s racial identity – live 6.04pm BST JD Vance, the Ohio senator and Donald Trump’s running mate, visited the Mexico-Arizona border on Thursday, during which he criticized the immigration policies of the Biden administration, which he repeatedly referred to as the “Harris administration”. Vance said Harris had been a “border czar” who had failed to curb the increased rates of migrants crossing the border. He said: It’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
